sentences.en: By temperament he was an artist.
sentences.cn: 从气质上看,他是一位画家.

sentences.en: Emily's mercurial temperament made her difficult to live with.
sentences.cn: 埃米莉脾气反复无常，很难与她相处。

sentences.en: Her mental capacity and temperament are as remarkable as his.
sentences.cn: 她的才智和气质和他一样出众。

sentences.en: His impulsive temperament regularly got him into difficulties.
sentences.cn: 他容易冲动，经常因此惹麻烦。

sentences.en: His only weakness is his temperament.
sentences.cn: 他唯一的缺点就是他那脾气。

sentences.en: His temperament is a bit odd.
In actuality, Teddie did not have a disorder but merely a difficult temperament.
sentences.cn: 实际上，小特迪并非哪不正常，而仅仅是属于困难型气质。

sentences.en: Mark does have a habit of allowing his temperament to get the better of him.
sentences.cn: 马克的确经常由着自己的性子来。

sentences.en: My profession had an important influence in the formation of my character and temperament.
sentences.cn: 我的职业对我性格和脾气的形成有重要的影响。

sentences.en: She was furtive and vicious by temperament.
sentences.cn: 她本来做事就偷偷摸摸，心肠狠毒。

sentences.en: Sister Yun was always of a nervous and sentimental temperament.
sentences.cn: 神为什么要去捉弄这些在家中的人儿?

sentences.en: Some of the models were given to fits of temperament.
The analysis of what kind of temperament you possess is vital.
sentences.cn: 分析一下你有什么样的气质是十分重要的.

words.tran_cn: 喜怒无常的；性情的；易兴奋的
缓和的，温和的；调节的；有…气质的
脾气；（钢等）回火；性情；倾向
使回火；锻炼；调和；使缓和
气质，性情，[心理]性格；急躁

trans.tran_cn: 性格，（人或动物的）气质，易冲动，（性情）暴躁
trans.tran_en: the emotional part of someone’s character, especially how likely they are to be happy, angry etc
